```{r}
covid.com = covid %>% full_join(covid.g1, by = c("STATE", "DATE"))
```





```{r}
combine.attributes <- function(x, y) {
  n = length(x)
  for (i in 1:n) {
    if (is.na(x[i])) {
      x[i] = y[i]
    }
  }
  return (x)
}
```


```{r}
redundant.attributes = c("STUSAB", "LATITUDE", "LONGITUDE", "STATEFP", "GNISID")
```


```{r}
clean.combined.data <- function(data, attrs) {
  for (name in attrs) {
    data[, name] = combine.attributes(covid.com[, paste(name, ".x", sep="")], covid.com[, paste(name, ".y", sep="")])
    data[, paste(name, ".x", sep="")] = NULL
    data[, paste(name, ".y", sep="")] = NULL
  }
  return (data)
}
```

```{r}
covid.com = clean.combined.data(covid.com, redundant.attributes)
```


```{r}
extend.scores <- function(data) {
  n = dim(data)[1]
  scores = rep(0, n)
  index = 1
  while (is.na(data$SCORE[index])) {index = index + 1}
  curr.score = 0
  while (index < n+1) {
    if (!(is.na(data$SCORE[index]))) {
      curr_score = data$SCORE[index]
    }
    scores[index] = curr_score
    index = index + 1
  }
  return (scores)
}
```


```{r}
covid.com$SCORE = extend.scores(covid.com)
```

```{r}
# generate top n states with the most people
top_pop_states <- function(data, n=5) {
  d = data %>% group_by(STATE) %>% summarize(POPULATION = mean(POPULATION, na.rm = TRUE))
  return (top_n(d, n=n, wt=POPULATION)[[1]])                             
}
```


```{r}
# plot covid cases for top population states
plot_states <- function(data, states, feature, x=2, y=3) {
  # top_states = top_pop_states(covid, n)
  par(mfrow=c(x,y), mar=c(4,4,2,0.5)) # Setup grid, margins
  for (state in states) {
    d = data %>% filter(STATE == state) %>% select(POPULATION, DATE, NEWCONFIRMED, CUMCONFIRMED, NEWDEATHS, CUMDEATHS)
    plot(d$DATE, d[,feature], xlab = "Time", ylab = feature, main = paste("COVID cases in", state), pch = 20)
  }
}
```






```{r}
states = top_pop_states(covid)
plot_states(covid, 'NEWDEATHS')
```


```{r}
plot_states(covid, 'NEWCONFIRMED')
```
